page.title: 10DEPOPULATION IN EDAY
page.content: On a tour round Eday one cannot help but notice the number of ruined and derelict houses scattered around the island. These are a direct result of depopulation in the Orkneys. In 1851 there were 947 people living on Eday. This was the maximum population the island had. By 1961 there were only 198 people and now in 1985, there are roughly 140 people living on Eday. Many of the old ruined houses are now used for storage by the crofters, perhaps for their winter hay, or as hen houses or they may have been converted into implement sheds. Some are left as ruins to crumble slowly away.
